org.sonatype.restsimple.api
Interface Action<T,U>

All Known Implementing Classes:
AddressBookAction, GenericAction, HelloWorldAction, PetstoreAction, TypedAction
public interface Action<T,U>

An abstract representation of a Service. An action is associated with one or more ServiceHandler. The ServiceHandler gets mapped from the URI and then its associated Action gets invoked. As an example, a pet action could look like 

    public class PetstoreAction implements Action<Pet, Pet> {

        public final static String APPLICATION = "application";
        public final static String JSON = "vnd.org.sonatype.rest+json";
        public final static String XML = "vnd.org.sonatype.rest+xml";
        public final static String PET_EXTRA_NAME = "petType";

        private final ConcurrentHashMap<String, Pet> pets = new ConcurrentHashMap<String, Pet>();

        @Override
        public Pet action(ActionContext<Pet> actionContext) throws ActionException {
            Map<String, Collection<String>> headers = actionContext.headers();
            Map<String, Collection<String>> paramsString = actionContext.paramsString();

            switch (actionContext.method()) {
                case GET:
                    Pet pet = pets.get(actionContext.pathValue());
                    return pet;
                case DELETE:
                    return pets.remove(actionContext.pathValue());
                case POST:
                    pet = actionContext.get();
                    pets.put(actionContext.pathValue(), pet);
                    return pet;
                default:
                    throw new ActionException(405);
            }
        }
    }
You can use the TypedAction for an implementation of an Action The de-serialization of the Request's body is always performed before the action(org.sonatype.restsimple.api.ActionContext) and the result can always be retrieved using ActionContext.get() The returned value of the action(org.sonatype.restsimple.api.ActionContext) will be serialized based on the information represented by the associated ServiceHandler. This class is not thread safe.

Method Summary
 T action(ActionContext<U> actionContext)
          Execute an action.
 

Method Detail

action

T action(ActionContext<U> actionContext)
         throws ActionException
Execute an action. An action can be anything.

Parameters:
actionContext - an ActionContext
Returns:
T a response to be serialized
Throws:
ActionException
